Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Audible \Au"di*ble\, a. [LL. audibilis, fr. L. audire, auditum, to hear: cf. Gr. ? ear, L. auris, and E. ear.] Capable of being heard; loud enough to be heard; actually heard; as, an audible voice or whisper. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Audible \Au"di*ble\, n. That which may be heard. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Visibles are swiftlier carried to the sense than audibles. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
audible adj : heard or perceptible by the ear; "he spoke in an audible whisper" [syn: {hearable}] [ant: {inaudible}]
